Wednesday Justice Department put Alabama notice state flagrant disregard constitutional rights inmates prisons The department conditions state prisons among nation worst After carefully reviewing evidence department officials wrote letter addressed Gov Kay Ivey conclude reasonable cause believe conditions Alabama prisons violate Eighth Amendment Constitution protects cruel unusual forms punishment The findings accompanying page report result investigation began 2016 shock conscience Violent attacks grisly deaths discovered long occurred Contraband makeshift weapons undetected Sexual abuse occurring hours day night Overcrowding excessive staffing inadequate inmates virtually unsupervised words former warden extreme danger Grossly inadequate health care And according federal statistics noted report highest prison homicide rate country The Justice Department found state failed protect inmates prisoner prisoner violence prisoner prisoner sexual abuse leading pattern practice constitutional violations throughout Alabama prison system Such disdain basic human decency calls immediate steps Alabama officials intend take requesting increased funding officers better modern prisons But intervention oversight needed announcing findings Justice Department effectively started day clock federal law Alabama take corrective actions risk lawsuit federal court This case cries consent decree Jonathan Smith former chief Justice Department civil rights unit charged making sure state local governments respect constitutional rights citizens William Barr America new attorney general ought seek court intervention state fails follow Justice Department recommendations include hiring 500 correctional officers revising security protocols addressing basic housing deficiencies bathrooms living areas disrepair rob inmates dignity Before Justice Department announcement The Times published account conditions one Alabama facilities review Clair Correctional toppled killed longtime dictator Moammar Gadhafi That conflict left behind patchwork local tribal Islamist militias governing various fiefdoms often extortion brute force transformed Libya extremists major conduit migrants making perilous journeys Europe Field Marshal Khalifa Hifter spent last years battling Islamic militants eastern Libya presents strong hand unify country rid extremists But opponents view another strongman mold Gadhafi HOW DID LIBYA GET HERE Inspired Arab Spring uprisings sweeping region Libyans rose February 2011 Gadhafi responded fierce military crackdown uprising quickly escalated civil war Gadhafi massed tanks outside eastern city Benghazi threatened massacre protesters street street NATO responded bombing campaign Gadhafi forces eventually provided close air support loose alliance rebel militias helping drive power The rebels captured Gadhafi home city Sirte October 2011 killed later releasing video footage beaten humiliated Libya held free elections following year government powerless control vast array militias democratic transition stalled Fighting erupted Tripoli summer 2014 leaving international airport largely destroyed resulting separate governments capital eastern Libya backed various armed groups 2015 backed formation transitional government Tripoli west leadership technocrat Fayez Sarraj separate government based east allied Hifter rejected authority WHO HIFTER Hifter helped Gadhafi seize power 1969 coup monarchy rose ranks military eventually commanding Libyan forces 1973 Arab Israeli war But reputation left tatters Libya disastrous defeat war Chad 1980s among thousands captured war wound defected joined armed opposition Gadhafi orchestrating number failed coup attempts eventually relocated Washington area lived exile years leading widespread speculation worked CIA returned Libya 2011 commanded forces uprising Gadhafi But soured revolution chaos following dictator death soon organized campaign various Islamic militant groups took root eastern Libya recent years fought series battles leaving swath destruction eventually retaking eastern Libya vital oil facilities Over last months quietly expanded influence across south winning local tribes factions cast opponents Islamic extremists modeled President Abdel Fattah Sissi neighboring Egypt led military overthrow elected divisive Islamist president 2013 Fundamentally Turkey democratic evolution hampered absence democratic leftist alternative The authoritarian right held sway since Turkish republic founded 1923 The historical record shows Sweden century ago Spain Greece Portugal 1970s strong democratic left crucial democratization The Turkish state consistently ruthless oppression left 1921 Mustafa Kemal Ataturk members leadership Turkish Communist Party killed fearing leftist challenge power banned trade unions imprisoned leftist intellectuals stripes Erdogan carried Ataturk legacy maintaining labor hostile order The government banned strikes nearly 200 000 workers Twenty two thousand workers lost lives workplace accidents since came power Turkey democratic travails conventionally explained supposed clash Islam secularism Turkish democracy generally inadequately understood undermined military allegedly staging coups protect secularism recent years Islamist ambitions Erdogan fact history Turkey shaped class politics obscured misleading narrative pits Islamization secularism Closer inspection reveals Turkey secularists Islamists represent two shades right wing ideology includes commitment unrestrained capitalism hostility labor conservatism nationalism Ataturk secular reforms laid foundations modern capitalist society successors made sense use Islam protect capitalism With onset Cold War Turkey ruling ostensibly first six full terms two years later Ernest Frederick Hollings born Charleston South Carolina Jan 1922 His father paper products dealer family business went broke Depression Hollings graduated The Citadel state military college Charleston 1942 immediately entered Army decorated service World War Back home earned law degree University South Carolina 1947 The next year elected state House age
